Configure the System SNMP User Profile

Use this task to configure the system SNMP user profile used to authenticate SNMP users on the PW EMS.

  1. From the navigation bar, click Settings > System.
  2. In the System Settings window, click Snmp User Profile Info and complete the following fields:

    Field

    Description
    Snmp User Profile Name field

    Enter the name of the SNMP user profile. the default SNMP user profile name is profile1.
    Snmp Target IP field

    Enter the IP address of the Northbound SNMP server or network management system.
    Snmp Target Port Enter the logical port number of the Northbound SNMP server or network management system. The default port is 161, which is designated for SNMP.
    Snmp Community

    Enter the SNMP community name string, which can be up to 64 characters for the PW EMS, which is the name of an active community where the device can send or receive SNMP performance and fault information, which applies for SNMP versions 1 and 2. The default SNMP community name string value is public.
    Snmp Version Enter the SNMP version string, which can be up to 64 characters that is supported by devices. The default value is version2c.
    Snmp User Name Enter an SNMP user name up to 128 characters for this profile.
    Snmp Authoritative EngineID (SNMP version 3 (v3) only) Enter the Engine ID used by SNMP v3 entities only to uniquely identify them. For example, an SNMP agent is considered an authoritative SNMP engine.
    Snmp Authentication Protocol (SNMP v3 only) Enter SNMP v3 authentication and privacy protocols. Authentication is used to ensure the identity of users.
    NOTE: SNMP v3 provides a higher level of security than SNMP v1 and v2c, which use community strings for security.
    Snmp Authentication Passphrase (SNMP v3 only) Enter the authentication passphrase for enhanced security that is used for SNMP v3 implementations.
    Snmp Privacy Protocol (SNMP v3 only) Enter the SNMP v3 privacy protocol, which can be up to 65 characters. For example, the CBC_DES or CFB_AES_128 SNMP v3 privacy protocol can be used.
    Snmp Privacy Passphrase (SNMP v3 only) Enter the privacy passphrase for enhanced security that is used with the authentication passphrase for SNMP v3 implementations.
Parent topic: Manage System Settings for Devices
